de.unisiegen.tpml.core.languages
Class AbstractLanguageScanner

java.lang.Object
  de.unisiegen.tpml.core.languages.AbstractLanguageScanner
All Implemented Interfaces:
LanguageScanner, java_cup.runtime.Scanner
Direct Known Subclasses:
AbstractLanguageTypeScanner, L0Scanner, L1Scanner, L2Scanner, L3Scanner, L4Scanner
public abstract class AbstractLanguageScanner
extends Object
implements LanguageScanner

Abstract base class for classes that implement the LanguageScanner interface.

Version:
$Rev: 380 $
Author:
Benedikt Meurer
See Also:
LanguageScanner

Constructor Summary
protected AbstractLanguageScanner()
          Allocates a new AbstractLanguageScanner, which implements the LanguageScanner interface and should be used as base class for all scanners generated by JFlex.
 
Method Summary
 PrettyStyle getStyleBySymbol(LanguageSymbol symbol)
          Returns the PrettyStyle for the symbol, for example PrettyStyle.CONSTANT if the symbol is a parsed integer, boolean or unit constant.
abstract  PrettyStyle getStyleBySymbolId(int id)
          Returns the PrettyStyle for the specified symbol id, for example PrettyStyle.KEYWORD if the id refers to the token "let".
 LanguageSymbol next_token()
          Implementation of the next_token() interface of the Scanner interface.
protected  LanguageSymbol symbol(String name, int id, int left, int right, Object value)
          Allocates a new LanguageSymbol with the specified name and symbol id.

Constructor Detail

AbstractLanguageScanner

protected AbstractLanguageScanner()
Allocates a new AbstractLanguageScanner, which implements the LanguageScanner interface and should be used as base class for all scanners generated by JFlex.

Method Detail

symbol

protected final LanguageSymbol symbol(String name,
                                      int id,
                                      int left,
                                      int right,
                                      Object value)
Allocates a new LanguageSymbol with the specified name and symbol id. The remaining parameters are optional, see the documentation of the LanguageSymbol and LanguageSymbolFactory classes for details.

Parameters:
name - the name of the symbol.
id - the unique identifier of the symbol.
left - the left position of the symbol, or -1.
right - the right position of the symbol, or -1.
value - the value of the symbol.
Returns:
the generated LanguageSymbol.

getStyleBySymbol

public final PrettyStyle getStyleBySymbol(LanguageSymbol symbol)
Returns the PrettyStyle for the symbol, for example PrettyStyle.CONSTANT if the symbol is a parsed integer, boolean or unit constant.

Specified by:
getStyleBySymbol in interface LanguageScanner
Parameters:
symbol - a LanguageSymbol previously returned by this scanner.
Returns:
the PrettyStyle for the symbol.
See Also:
languages.LanguageScanner#getStyleBySymbol(languages.LanguageSymbol)

getStyleBySymbolId

public abstract PrettyStyle getStyleBySymbolId(int id)
Returns the PrettyStyle for the specified symbol id, for example PrettyStyle.KEYWORD if the id refers to the token "let". This method must be implemented by all lexers generated by JFlex.

Parameters:
id - the unique identifier of a symbol.
Returns:
the PrettyStyle for the symbol id.
See Also:
getStyleBySymbol(LanguageSymbol)

next_token

public final LanguageSymbol next_token()
                                throws IOException,
                                       LanguageScannerException
Implementation of the next_token() interface of the Scanner interface. This is a simple wrapper around the nextSymbol() method, which automatically skips all symbols that should be ignored by the parser.

Specified by:
next_token in interface java_cup.runtime.Scanner
Returns:
the next symbol from the scanner, skipping all tokens that should be ignored by the parser, or null on end-of-file.
Throws:
IOException - if an error occurs while reading characters from the input source stream.
LanguageScannerException - if a syntax error occurred while trying to scan the input stream.
See Also:
Scanner.next_token()
